thing-type.label: ZSE11 Q Sensor
thing-type.description: Q Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<ul&gt<li&gtQuick and reliable motion alerts to Z-Wave hub</li&gt <li&gtAccurate temperature and humidity monitoring</li&gt <li&gtLux sensor for smart light automation</li&gt <li&gtBattery or Micro USB power</li&gt <li&gtThe latest S2 security and Z-Wave Plus chip</li&gt <li&gtSupports OTA fiormware updates</li&gt <li&gtBuilt-in tamper switch for extra security</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtPut your Z-Wave hub into inclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtClick the Z-Wave button 3 times as quickly as possible. The LED indicator will start blinking to confirm inclusion mode and turn off once inclusion is completed. The sensor will automatically pair as a repeater if connected to USB power, so special button sequence required.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtNEVER include the sensor powered with USB and then switch over to batteries. Your hub will recognize the sensor as a Z-Wave repeater and the batteries will drain quickly. Always include the sensor powered by batteries only if you're planning to use it as a battery device.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtBring the sensor within direct range of your Z-Wave gateway (hub).</li&gt <li&gtPut the Z-Wave binding into exclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtPress and release the Z-Wave button 3 times quickly.</li&gt <li&gtYour hub will confirm exclusion and the sensor will disappear from your controller's device list.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe sensor's wake-up intevral is set to 4 hours by default to save battery life. Use the Wake up Command Class to adjust the interval (in seconds, working in 3600s intervals, with 120 as min and 86400 as max values). Press and hold the Z-Wave button for 3 seconds to wake the sensor up manually. During wake-up, the sensor turns on the Z-Wave radio for a couple of seconds to receive communication from the hub. Long wake-up intervals will not affect how often the sensor reports motion or other values to your hub.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: Motion sensitivity
parameter.description: Motion sensitivity<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 is disabled, 1 is low sensitivity, and 8 is high sensitivity.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: Motion clear time
parameter.description: The delay in seconds before the sensor reports no motion<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe delay in seconds before the sensor reports no motion to the hub and associated devices after detecting the last motion activity.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_172_2
parameter.label: 172: Reporting frequency
parameter.description: The reporting frequency for battery, temperature, humidity, and light level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet the reporting frequency for battery, temperature, humidity, and light level. This is the minimum interval in which the sensor will send updates to the hub even if the reporting threshold isn't met. The values correspond to the number of hours.</p&gt <p&gtNote: Frequent reports will affect battery life.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_183_2
parameter.label: 183: Temperature reporting threshold
parameter.description: Temperature reporting threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe sensor will report a new temperature value to the hub whenever temperature changes by the number of degrees entered as value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_184_1
parameter.label: 184: Humidity reporting threshold
parameter.description: Humidity reporting threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet the reporting threshold for humidity. The sensor will report a new humidity value to the hub whenever humidity changes by the percentage number entered as value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_185_2
parameter.label: 185: Lux reporting threshold
parameter.description: Lux reporting threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet the reporting threshold for lux. The sensor will report new lux to the hub whenever the brightness level changes by the number of lux entered as value.</p&gt</p&gt
